div.head: Generic functions
div.p: In wdbplus we provide different generic functions. To date, these are a way to produce a generic home page

div.head: Generic home page
div.p:
If a project does not want to provide a special starting page for the digital edition, users can create a generic starting page if they provide the following data in wdbmeta in the element titleData:
title type='main'
titel type='short'
involvement
date
coverImages
These items can contain one or several entries.

div.head: The title elements
div.p: Both title elements contain some form of a title, either the official one, or a shorthand for it.

div.head: The involvement-element
div.p: The involvement element can contain references to one or multiple involved people or organisations.

div.head: The date-element
div.p: This element will always be a date in iso-format - for example: 1485-01-01

div.head: the coverImages-element
div.p: This contains the path to one or several images on the some page. If it's more than one, they will be shown as a carousell.

div.head: Where to find the function
div.p:
the files can be found in
/edoc/modules/start.xqm
/edoc/resources/start.xsl
The start.xqm
The start.xqm contains two functions: getStartLeft and getStart. The getStartLeft deals with the content displayed in the aside-element, which is, by default, displayed on the left side of the home page. The standard for getStartLeft is the content (struct in wdbmeta) of the project. The getStart deals with the main, which is by default the right part of the site.
The start.xsl
This contains the xslt for the generic starting page.
If you want to change it on a project-level: link to project/resource/startLeft.html and startRight.html; if you want to change it globally, you can override the default behaviour by changing edoc/data/instance.xqm

div.head: Instance specifics
div.p: Everything that exists globally, i.e. in the collection "edoc" can be overwritten for the specific instance that you are running. in edoc/data/insta.xqm you can define specific behaviour for these functions, etc.
